description: HyperTrack lets you build location features, without worrying about infrastructure.

blocks.name: createDriver
blocks.description: Create and return a Driver object.

args.name: vehicleType
args.info: The default vehicle type of the driver. Must be one of 'walking, bicycle, motorcycle, car, 3-wheeler, van, flight, train, ship'.

args.name: phone
args.info: E164 formatted phone number of the driver.

args.name: photo
args.info: A photo file of the driver.

args.name: lookupId
args.info: A unique id that you can add to the driver to search.

args.name: fleetId
args.info: The identifier of the fleet to which the driver belongs.

blocks.name: getSingleDriver
blocks.description: Retrieves a driver object with the id.

blocks.name: updateDriver
blocks.description: Edit an existing driver object.

args.name: vehicleType
args.info: The default vehicle type of the driver. Must be one of 'walking, bicycle, motorcycle, car, 3-wheeler, van, flight, train, ship'.

args.name: phone
args.info: E164 formatted phone number of the driver.

args.name: photo
args.info: A photo file of the driver.

args.name: lookupId
args.info: A unique id that you can add to the driver to search.

args.name: fleetId
args.info: The identifier of the fleet to which the driver belongs.

blocks.name: deleteDriver
blocks.description: Delete an existing customer object.

blocks.name: getDrivers
blocks.description: List all driver objects. The list can be filtered using the following parameters.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Maximum number of objects to return, default is 50.

args.name: name
args.info: Filter drivers with names that contain this string.

args.name: id
args.info: Filter drivers with a comma separated list of ids.

args.name: bbox
args.info: Filter driver objects by bounding box, specified as max_lng, max_lat, min_lng, min_lat.

args.name: minDate
args.info: Filter objects by minimum created at date.

args.name: maxDate
args.info: Filter objects by maximum created at date.

blocks.name: getDriverOverview
blocks.description: Retrieves the overview of an existing driver's performance. Supply the unique identifier that was returned on driver creation.

args.name: minDate
args.info: Minimum date as ISO datetime string to get statistics for a driver.

args.name: maxDate
args.info: Maximum date as ISO datetime string to get statistics for a driver.

blocks.name: getDriversLocations
blocks.description: Returns a minimal list of your drivers with location to display on a map.

args.name: fleetId
args.info: Filter only drivers of a particular fleet.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: The number of entries to return in a page (maximum of 200).

args.name: minDate
args.info: Minimum created date as ISO datetime string to filter drivers.

args.name: maxDate
args.info: Maximum created date as ISO datetime string to filter drivers.

blocks.name: assignTaskToDriver
blocks.description: This API will assign a Task to a Driver. We recommend using this after you have created tasks and want to start tracking them. If driver is on a Trip when the call is made, we add these task to the currently running Trip, else we create a new Trip and start tracking it for you. When all tasks are marked completed, we end the Trip and stop tracking.

args.name: taskId
args.info: Task id to be assigned to the driver.

blocks.name: endTripForDriver
blocks.description: This API will end the live trip for a Driver.

blocks.name: endShiftForDriver
blocks.description: This API will end the live shift for a Driver.

blocks.name: createTrip
blocks.description: Creates a new trip object. By default, it also starts the trip.

args.name: driverId
args.info: The id of the driver who will be on trip. If not specified, a new driver will be created for the purpose of the trip.

args.name: startLocation
args.info: The start location of the trip.

args.name: tasks
args.info: The array of task ids to be performed on the trip, in format ["b2249ba8-e88c-455e-b02f-672677828ddc"].

args.name: vehicleType
args.info: The vehicle type to be used in the trip. If not specified, this defaults to vehicle type of driver. Possible types are walking, bicycle, motorcycle, car, 3-wheeler, van.

args.name: hasOrderedTasks
args.info: Set true to indicate the tasks have a pre-defined sequence as specified in tasks. Default is false.

args.name: isAutoEnded
args.info: Set false if the trip should not end after the last task is completed. Default is true, and the trip ends after the last task is completed.

blocks.name: endTrip
blocks.description: Ends a live trip by trip id.

args.name: endTime
args.info: Time at which the trip ends, defaults to current time.

blocks.name: getSingleTrip
blocks.description: Retrieves a trip object with the id.

blocks.name: deleteTrip
blocks.description: Delete an existing trip object.

blocks.name: getTrips
blocks.description: List all trip objects. The list can be filtered using the following parameters.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Maximum number of objects to return, default is 50.

args.name: driverId
args.info: Filter trips for a particular driver id.

args.name: id
args.info: Filter trips with a comma separated list of ids.

args.name: status
args.info: Filter trips for a particular status, can be one of live, ended, suspended.

args.name: minDate
args.info: Filter objects by minimum created at date.

args.name: maxDate
args.info: Filter objects by maximum created at date.

blocks.name: addTaskToTrip
blocks.description: This API lets you add Tasks to a live Trip. Only tasks that have not been completed can be added to a Trip.

args.name: taskId
args.info: The id of the task to be added.

blocks.name: removeTaskFromTrip
blocks.description: This API lets you remove Tasks to a live Trip. Only tasks that are on the Trip and have not been completed can be removed.

args.name: taskId
args.info: The id of the task to be removed.

blocks.name: changeTripTasksSequence
blocks.description: This API lets you reorder Tasks of a live Trip. This can only be done for Trips that have has_ordered_tasks as true.

args.name: taskOrder
args.info: Array of task ids in the new sequence. Must have all ids of tasks on the trip, in format ["3a36b6df-a7e7-40d0-86b7-b5aae1ce3a2b", "77b9a3fa-a3ab-4840-aadb-cd33442ca45b"]

blocks.name: createTask
blocks.description: Creates a new task object.

args.name: destinationId
args.info: The id of the destination where the task will be performed.

args.name: action
args.info: The action of the task, possible values are pickup, delivery, visit or task. Defaults to task.

args.name: orderId
args.info: An id that you can specify based on your internal ids.

args.name: committedEta
args.info: The eta commitment made to the customer to measure on-time performance, in format "2000-01-01T12:00:00.00Z".

blocks.name: createTaskWithNewDestination
blocks.description: Creates a new task object with creating new destination.

args.name: customerId
args.info: The id of the customer to which this destination belongs.

args.name: zipCode
args.info: Zip or postal code of the destination.

args.name: action
args.info: The action of the task, possible values are pickup, delivery, visit or task. Defaults to task.

args.name: orderId
args.info: An id that you can specify based on your internal ids.

args.name: committedEta
args.info: The eta commitment made to the customer to measure on-time performance, in format "2000-01-01T12:00:00.00Z".

blocks.name: completeTask
blocks.description: Completes a Task.

args.name: completionTime
args.info: Timestamp when task is completed, default to current time.

args.name: completionLocation
args.info: Location at which task is completed.

blocks.name: cancelTask
blocks.description: Cancels a Task. Canceled tasks cannot be restarted, removed or completed.

args.name: cancelationTime
args.info: Timestamp when task is canceled, default to current time.

blocks.name: getSingleTask
blocks.description: Retrieves a task object with the id.

blocks.name: updateDestinationLocation
blocks.description: Updates the location of the destination of the task.

args.name: locationLatitude
args.info: Location latitude of the new destination.

args.name: locationLongitude
args.info: Location longitude of the new destination.

blocks.name: getTasks
blocks.description: List all tasks objects. The list can be filtered using the following parameters.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Maximum number of objects to return, default is 50.

args.name: driverId
args.info: Filter tasks that are assigned to a driver.

args.name: minDate
args.info: Filter objects by minimum created at date.

args.name: maxDate
args.info: Filter objects by maximum created at date.

blocks.name: deleteTask
blocks.description: Delete an existing task object.

blocks.name: createShift
blocks.description: Creates a new shift object.

args.name: driverId
args.info: The id of the driver on shift.

args.name: startedAt
args.info: Start time of the shift, default is current time.

blocks.name: getSingleShift
blocks.description: Retrieves a shift object with the id.

blocks.name: endShift
blocks.description: Ends a shift object with the id.

blocks.name: deleteShift
blocks.description: Delete an existing shift object.

blocks.name: getShifts
blocks.description: List all shift objects. The list can be filtered using the following parameters.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Maximum number of objects to return, default is 50.

args.name: id
args.info: Filter shifts with a comma separated list of ids.

args.name: driverId
args.info: Filter shift objects for a particular driver.

args.name: isActive
args.info: Filter only active or inactive shifts.

args.name: minDate
args.info: Filter objects by minimum created at date.

args.name: maxDate
args.info: Filter objects by maximum created at date.

blocks.name: createDestination
blocks.description: Creates a new destination object.

args.name: customerId
args.info: The id of the customer to which this destination belongs.

args.name: zipCode
args.info: Zip or postal code of the destination.

blocks.name: getSingleDestination
blocks.description: Retrieves the details of an existing destination.

blocks.name: updateDestination
blocks.description: Edit an existing destination object.

args.name: customerId
args.info: The id of the customer to which this destination belongs.

args.name: zipCode
args.info: Zip or postal code of the destination.

blocks.name: deleteDestination
blocks.description: Delete an existing destination object.

blocks.name: getDestinations
blocks.description: Returns a list of your destinations. The destinations are returned sorted by updated date, with the most recently updated destinations appearing first.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Maximum number of objects to return, default is 50.

args.name: minDate
args.info: Filter objects by minimum created at date.

args.name: maxDate
args.info: Filter objects by maximum created at date.

blocks.name: createCustomer
blocks.description: Creates a new customer object.

args.name: phone
args.info: E164 formatted phone number of customer.

blocks.name: getSingleCustomer
blocks.description: Retrieves a customer object with the id.

blocks.name: updateCustomer
blocks.description: Edit an existing customer object.

args.name: phone
args.info: E164 formatted phone number of customer.

blocks.name: deleteCustomer
blocks.description: Delete an existing customer object.

blocks.name: getCustomers
blocks.description: List all customer objects. The list can be filtered using the following parameters.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Maximum number of objects to return, default is 50.

args.name: name
args.info: Filter customers with names that contain this string.

args.name: id
args.info: Filter customers with a comma separated list of ids.

args.name: minDate
args.info: Filter objects by minimum created at date.

args.name: maxDate
args.info: Filter objects by maximum created at date.

blocks.name: createFleet
blocks.description: Creates a new fleet object.

blocks.name: getSingleFleet
blocks.description: Retrieves a fleet object with the id.

blocks.name: updateFleet
blocks.description: Edit an existing fleet object.

blocks.name: deleteFleet
blocks.description: Delete an existing fleet object.

blocks.name: getFleets
blocks.description: List all fleet objects. The list can be filtered using the following parameters.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Maximum number of objects to return, default is 50.

args.name: name
args.info: Filter fleets with names that contain this string.

args.name: minDate
args.info: Filter objects by minimum created at date.

args.name: maxDate
args.info: Filter objects by maximum created at date.

blocks.name: getSingleNeighborhood
blocks.description: Retrieves a neighborhood object with the id.

blocks.name: getNeighborhoods
blocks.description: List all neighborhood objects.

blocks.name: getSingleEvent
blocks.description: This API retrieves the details of an event. Supply the unique identifier of the event, which you might have received in a webhook. All events share a common structure, detailed below. The only property that will differ is the data property. In each case, the data dictionary will have an attribute called object and its value will be the same as retrieving the same object directly from the API. For example, a order.created event will have the same information as retrieving the relevant order would.

blocks.name: getEvents
blocks.description: Retrieve list of all events.

blocks.name: createGPSLog
blocks.description: Creates a new gpslog object.

args.name: driverId
args.info: The driver id to which this location belongs.

args.name: recordedAt
args.info: The timestamp at which the location was recorded.

args.name: locationAccuracy
args.info: The location accuracy of the location in meters.

args.name: bearing
args.info: The bearing in degrees from the N-S axis.

args.name: altitude
args.info: The altitude above sea level in meters.

args.name: activities
args.info: List of activities recorded with the location. Possible activities are stationary, walking, running, automotive, cycling or unknown.

args.name: activityConfidence
args.info: Confidence level of the recorded activities, between 0 to 100.

blocks.name: createBulkGPSLogs
blocks.description: Create multiple GPS logs, by sending a list of GPS Log objects.

args.name: gpsLogObjectsList
args.info: Array of JSON objects, list of GPS Log objects.

blocks.name: getSingleGPSLog
blocks.description: Retrieves a GPS Log object with the id.

blocks.name: getFilteredGPSLogs
blocks.description: GPS Log data from the device is filtered to remove noise and improve accuracy. This filtered list can be retrieve with this API. You can also specify parameters to query GPS Log objects of a particular driver or time period.

args.name: pageSize
args.info: Maximum number of objects to return, default is 50.

args.name: driverId
args.info: Filter GPS Log objects by driver.

args.name: minRecordedAt
args.info: Filter objects by minimum device timestamp.

args.name: maxRecordedAt
args.info: Filter objects by maximum device timestamp.

args.name: minDate
args.info: Filter objects by minimum created at date.

args.name: maxDate
args.info: Filter objects by maximum created at date.

blocks.name: deleteGPSLog
blocks.description: Delete an existing GPS Log object.
